headline.main: F.C.C. VOTES DOWN FAIRNESS DOCTRINE IN A 4-0 DECISION

byline.original: By ROBERT D. HERSHEY Jr., Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Federal Communications Commission voted unanimously today to abolish its fairness doctrine on the ground that it unconstitutionally restricts the free-speech rights of broadcast journalists.
docs.snippet: LEAD: The Federal Communications Commission voted unanimously today to abolish its fairness doctrine on the ground that it unconstitutionally restricts the free-speech rights of broadcast journalists.
